description:
This course introduces the principles of vibration for linear discrete and continuous systems. It will start
with the revision of the single degree of freedom spring mass system and then expanded into the study
of the free and forced vibration of one degree-of-systems and multiple degree-of-freedom-systems
including damping. Major topics includes the natural modes of vibration and the associated eigenvalue
problems. Students will aslo be exposed to vibration simulation using SOLIDWORKS. The remaining
topics include the vibration of continuous systems such as string, rods and beams and techniques for
vibration measurement.
title: Vibration Theory and Applications
